a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;
FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;
FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;
FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: A group of arrays that are assayed at the same time. Information about the experimental protocol is entered into a MIAME-compliant database integrated into PhenoGen. Each array in the experiment represents a hybridization and is linked to a sample.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: iDecoder is a tool that maps gene identifiers between databases. For instance, if database 1 contains entry A and database 2 contains entry B, and both A and B refer to entry C in database 3, but not to each other, iDecoder will identify that A and B are related.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: See Integrative Neuroscience Initiative on Alcoholism.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: A consortium created to identify the molecular, cellular, and behavioral neuroadaptations that occur in the brain reward circuits associated with the extended amygdala and its connections.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: Linear Models for Microarrays. Collection of tools used for normalization and statistical analysis of cDNA and oligonucleotide arrays.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: Minimum Information About a Microarray Experiment. MIAME is a standard for exchanging microarray experimental data in such a way as to make it easily interpreted and allow for easy and independent verification.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: A 2D array, typically on a glass, filter, or silicon wafer, upon which genes or gene fragments are deposited or synthesized in a predetermined spatial order allowing them to be made available as probes in a high-throughput, parallel manner.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: A motif is a sequence pattern that occurs repeatedly in a group of related protein or DNA sequences.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;
FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: (a.k.a. PI) 1. Often the head of a lab. 2. Typically the array owner. 3. The person responsible for granting permission to other users to view the arrays.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: Quantitative Trait Locus. An area of the genome that is associated with variation in a quantitative trait.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: After selecting run-groups and normalizing data for a saved experiment, a "version" of the experiment is created.
